intro: Dalechampia burgeriana, commonly known as the Mexican elephant tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its thick, woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Its bark is thick and fibrous, providing it with some resistance to drought and browsing. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appearance and ecological role.
